reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The situation is lovely, the rooms warm, comfortable and clean. The food is good and the service excellent. However breakfast is expensive and ordinary and the proprietors seem to regard their drinks tarif and wine list as an excuse to print money.(Most aperitifs 7 euros, bottle of water 6 euros, cidre du ferme 15 euros). If I can have wine at twice the supermarket price I feel that I have a bargain, two and a half to three times and 'Oh well that's life' but when it gets up to four times and more I will usually drink water and that would have been the case here if it wasn't our last night after a nine week trip around Europe.
reviews.title: Nice place but poor value

reviews.text: Lovely countryside setting with farm animals everywhere: chickens, rabbits, pigs, cows, etc - kids loved that part. The family are welcoming enough but the restaurant part of this outfit lets everything else down. The service isn't great and the food is extremely basic whilst being very expensive. We were served boiled veg without seasoning and my salad was limp and wilting at the edges. All very 'school dinnerish'. The rooms are comfortable but again, a bit overpriced. My advice would be to stay here by all means but don't used the restaurant !
reviews.title: Overpriced in general - very poor quality dining

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many thanks for a wonderful stay. We booked for a Friday 16 December for a quick trip across the channel to pick up some Christmas provisions. I booked one of the club rooms which was above the main building the stairs were steep but the room was tastefully decorated and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Thanks for a lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutly loved sitting in front of the most beautiful wood burner I have ever seen in the lounge with our pre dinner drinks and nibbles.The evening meal was wonderful several fish dishes to choose from which pleased my wife. The breakfast was served in the garden room which looks out across a wonderful lawn which on a sunny morning must be fantastic because it looked great on a damp and slightly misty December morning.
reviews.title: Excellent dinner, quirky room in former loft, fair buffet breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will I be going back yes I will possibly for a longer stay.
reviews.title: One of the best buffet breakfasts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is in a rural setting, you need a car / taxi to get there. It is near a pleasant village with reasonable facilities, a great place for walks. We had an excellent dinner, a quirky room to sleep in, in former loft. We had a better than average, for France, buffet breakfast. We would cheerfully go back again and again for dinner. The bathroom in our "loft conversion" was odd with all facilities squeezed in, if I were older and arthritic it could have been a problem. HAVING SAID THAT WE SHALL BE RETURNING AND HAVE EXPERIENCED MUCH WORSE BATHROOMS IN CONVERSIONS IN FRANCE. There are plenty of small farm animals, some unusual breeds, roaming in enclosures in the grounds, which would appeal to small children
reviews.title: Peaceful and relaxing

reviews.text: If you stay on a Sunday, or Monday remember that they don't serve dinner on these nights. They recommend Le Speranza in Wimereux ( amongst other restaurants) . We left it too late to get a table there......which is a shame because it looked like the best alternative. So get your reservation in quick!
reviews.title: Ok, though a tad too expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An overnight stay only thirty minutes to chunnel. Set in the countryside with lovely gardens to sit out in this hotel is one for peace and quiet in the middle of a long journey. The restaurant was however closed on the Monday leaving us to find an alternative place to eat with little nearby, they obviously think more of their staff than the guests. The room we booked ended up being one of only two in the loft space of the annex building with a steep winding staircase, given I was on crutches no alternative was offered which was surprising as we were the only guests at the time and only two other parties arrived later. The room was very clean but being in the loft space had no views, only high Velox windows, and had very restricted head space in the bathroom and over the bed compounded by beams running through the room, the head was bumped on several occasions. Given our personal experience I would not book this hotel again, I do not feel it represented good value for the price nor a level of comfort and amenities I would expect. The breakfast did somewhat make up for other disappointments although this was a little overpriced at 13 euros.
reviews.title: Not sure we would return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and had a great time. The room was lovely and spacy. Sitting in the magnificent garden was a real pleasure.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For breakfast there was a buffet with lots of home-made products and plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Beautiful location but restaurant dinner poor

reviews.text: This is an ideal place for a romantic getaway or a relaxing holiday.
reviews.title: Lovely spot. A good find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed for one night with our friends. We were given lovely rooms next to each other with a little private sitting area in between. The garden is absolutely beautiful and it's lovely to see all the animals around. The two gentlemen who run it were very nice and we managed to make ourselves understood. However, the dinner was overpriced and poor quality. The chicken was stringy and the streak cold by the time you ate it. Breakfast was good though if a little expensive. We often pop over on the tunnel with our friends - third time this year alaready - but won't be visiting this hotel again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, nice location, but a little overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely little hotel in great surroundings. Food in the restaurant was tasty and nicely presented. Wine list good but on the expensive side. Nice for an overnight stop but nowhere else to eat and restaurant not open Sunday/ Monday evenings.
reviews.title: Beautiful surroundings

reviews.text: The restaurant was excellent with a good menu and a nice wine list. The food was fantastic on the first night, maybe less so on the second as we didn't want to eat the same meal twice. The family room was comfortable apart from one night when it was just too hot to sleep. Lovely gardens, especially for drinking a large, cold beer in!
reviews.title: Not cheap but very pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was expensive at 14 Euros each - we ended up eating at a cafe in Marquise up the road for 18 Euros for all 4 of us. On a very warm day (30C) the family room was too hot - it is on the top floor of a two-storey building and it just never cooled down.
reviews.title: relaxing friendly hotel and good restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good base for touring around Boulogne and so easy to get to. Nice setting, pretty garden, and lots of space. Restaurant has a small menu of very good quality food. Wine list very good too. Not a cheap get away - a destination as well as a stop-over with some character.
reviews.title: Pas De Calais - a little bit of heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Choose rooms carefully - upstairs rooms accessed by very steep stairs.
reviews.title: Nice play to stay. Don't rely on the restuarant being open though.
